Functional Neuroanatomy\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd course will be in its 15th year running in 2015.</rss:description>              <dc:creator>Sarah Lawson</dc:creator>       <dc:creator>David R Blundred</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2013-08-12T10:52:34Z</dc:date>              <silvanews:start_datetime>2015-03-23T00:00:00Z</silvanews:start_datetime>       <silvanews:end_datetime>2015-03-26T00:00:00Z</silvanews:end_datetime>            </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ion/articles/courses/neurology">       <rss:title>Neurology 2015: leading edge neurology for the practising clinician - 25-27 March 2015</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ion/articles/courses/neurology</rss:link>       <rss:description>It is a pleasure to announce this 2nd Annual course, a highlight  of the British Neurology calendar. The course is for consultants and  senior trainees in neurology and other neuroscience specialties, from Britain Europe and elsewhere, and  aims to provide a comprehensive update on the practical hospital  management of neurological diseases. The half day event on Wednesday 25th March 2015 is open to Clinical Trainees and Research Fellows in Neurology and associated specialities. It is a precursor to the full course, taking place on Thursday 26th and Friday 27th March 2015.   The emphasis of the course  is on modern techniques and therapies in a clinical setting, and the  clinical practice of neurology. The course is taught via lectures, video  sessions, CPC and a 'Town Hall' session, and intends to be didactic but  also entertaining and informative.\ufffd\ufffd    Features include:\ufffd\ufffd   </rss:description>              <dc:creator>Sarah Lawson</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2013-09-16T12:37:23Z</dc:date>              <silvanews:start_datetime>2015-03-25T09:00:00Z</silvanews:start_datetime>       <silvanews:end_datetime>2015-03-27T17:00:00Z</silvanews:end_datetime>            </rss:item>           <rss:item National Hospital for Neurology and Neurosurgery, 33 Queen Square, London WC1N 3BG</rss:description>              <dc:creator>Sarah Lawson</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2014-02-24T14:53:55Z</dc:date>       <silvanews:location>Clinical Neuroscience Lecture Theatre, National Hospital for Neurology and Neurosurgery, 33 Queen Square, London WC1N 3BG</silvanews:location>       <silvanews:start_datetime>2015-05-04T23:00:00Z</silvanews:start_datetime>       <silvanews:end_datetime>2015-05-07T23:00:00Z</silvanews:end_datetime>            </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ion/articles/courses/SPM2014">       <rss:title>Statistical Parametric Mapping short courses</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ion/articles/courses/SPM2014</rss:link>       <rss:description> The course will present instruction on the analysis of EEG and MEG data.\ufffd\ufffd The first two days will combine theoretical presentations with practical demonstrations of the different data analysis methods implemented in SPM.\ufffd\ufffd On the last day participants will have the opportunity to work on SPM tutorial data sets under the supervision of the course faculty.\ufffd\ufffd We also invite students to bring their own data for analysis. The course is suitable for both beginners and more advanced users. We advise students to gain at least some minimal familiarity with the methodology, for example, from reading introductory articles available from the SPM web page ( http://www.fil.ion.ucl.ac.uk/spm/doc/ ) or by scanning through Litvak et al. (2011) \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdEEG and MEG data analysis in SPM8\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, Comput Intell Neurosci 2011:852961.  </rss:description>              <dc:creator>Sarah Lawson</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2014-02-20T18:58:40Z</dc:date>       <silvanews:location>Basement Lecture Theatre, 33 Queen Square, London, WC1N 3BG</silvanews:location>       <silvanews:start_datetime>2015-05-10T23:00:00Z</silvanews:start_datetime>       <silvanews:end_datetime>2015-05-15T23:00:00Z</silvanews:end_datetime>            </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ion/articles/courses/paces">       <rss:title>MRCP PACES Neurology Course Queen Square</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ion/articles/courses/paces</rss:link>       <rss:description>        16th May 2015</rss:description>              <dc:creator>Sarah Lawson</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2014-10-10T16:54:41Z</dc:date>              <silvanews:start_datetime>2015-05-15T23:00:00Z</silvanews:start_datetime>       <silvanews:end_datetime>2015-05-15T23:00:00Z</silvanews:end_datetime>            </rss:item>           <rss:item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ion/articles/courses/neurotrialsday">       <rss:title>NeuroTrials Day</rss:title>       <rss:link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ion/articles/courses/neurotrialsday</rss:link>       <rss:description>    24th June 2015 in the basement lecture theatre at 33 Queen Square  </rss:description>              <dc:creator>David R Blundred</dc:creator>              <dc:date>2015-03-10T15:07:15Z</dc:date>       <silvanews:location>Lecture Theatre, 33 Queen Square</silvanews:location>       <silvanews:start_datetime>2015-06-23T23:00:00Z</silvanews:start_datetime>       <silvanews:end_datetime>2015-06-23T23:00:00Z</silvanews:end_datetime>            </rss:item>    </rdf:RDF>
